CatDescriptText: Mr. Gene Koen, radio salesman, Penn Hills, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Who do you think is responsible for the failure to pass effective civil rights legislation in Congress?"  Answer reads: "It's hard to place the failure on any one person. It is due to a combination of circumstances and conditions."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gene Koen wearing dark suit jacket and patterned necktie with clip, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunders Flowers store window, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
